wufit.cpp

00001 
00002 //  w  u  f i t 
00003 //
00004 //  Washington University Spectral Fitting Package for Whipple & VERITAS
00005 //  Gamma-Ray telescope data.
00006 //
00007 //  by Henric Krawczynski (2003-07-30)
00009 
00010 #include <iostream>
00011 #include <getopt.h>
00012 #include <cstdlib>
00013 #include <fstream>
00014 #include <string>
00015 #include <exception>
00016 #include <stdexcept>
00017 #include <iomanip>
00018 
00019 
00020 #include "Histogram.h"
00021 #include "EnergySpectrum.h"
00022 #include "Fitter.h"
00023 #include "Exceptions.h"
00024 #include "Config.h"
00025 
00026 using namespace std;
00027 
00028 int
00029 main( int argc , char **argv ) {
00030     
00031     cout << "wufit - spectral fitting "<< VERSION
00032          << " <krawcz@wuphys.wustl.edu> " << endl
00033          << "Washington University Physics Department, St. Louis M0"
00034          << endl
00035          << "============================================================" 
00036          << endl << endl;
00037     
00038     // Get Input Parameters
00039     // The Data Histograms Have to Be in the Directory 
00040     // "Totals/energy-total-on.hist" and
00041     // Totals/energy-total-off.hist
00042     
00043     if (argc<10)  {
00044         cout << "Usage  : wufit <configfile> "
00045              << "N0 Gamma Time(minutes) dN0 Steps dGamma Steps onoff-ratio E_CUTOFF(TeV)" << endl;
00046         cout << "Example: wufit sample.conf "
00047              << "3.3E-7 -2.49 10000. 1. 20 1 20 1.0 4.33"<<endl;
00048         exit (-1);
00049     }
00050 
00051     // NOTE: Time should really be the total livetime.
00052 
00053     char *conffile = argv[1];
00054     double N0     = atof(argv[2]);
00055     double Gamma  = atof(argv[3]);
00056     double Time   = atof(argv[4]) *  60.0 ;
00057     
00058     double dN0    = atof(argv[5]);
00059     int    n0Steps= atoi(argv[6]);    
00060     double dGamma = atof(argv[7]);
00061     int    gSteps = atoi(argv[8]);
00062     double onoffratio = atof(argv[9]); 
00063     double E0 = atof(argv[10]);
00064 
00065     // Load the configuration information...
00066     // just need to look at one run to get the global information.
00067     RunInfo ri;
00068     Config conf( conffile );
00069     if (!conf.isDone()) {
00070         ri = conf.getNextRun();
00071     }
00072     else {
00073         cout << "Please specify at least one run in the configuration file"
00074              << endl << "otherwise, the setup and cuts cannot be determined"
00075              << endl << endl;
00076 
00077         exit(1);
00078         
00079     }
00080 
00081     cout << "N0    Starting Value: " << N0      <<endl
00082          << "Gamma Starting Value: " << Gamma   <<endl
00083          << "Time           Value: " << Time    <<endl
00084          << "Delta N0            : " << dN0     << endl
00085          << "N0 Steps            : " << n0Steps << endl
00086          << "Delta Gamma         : " << dGamma  << endl
00087          << "Gamma Steps         : " << gSteps  << endl 
00088          << "ON/OFF ratio        : " << onoffratio << endl 
00089          << "Energy Cutoff       : " << E0 << endl
00090          << endl;
00091 
00092     try {
00093     
00094         //
00095         // Get Data Histograms
00096         // 
00097         
00098         EnergySpectrum* energy_on = new EnergySpectrum(ri,"EnergyEstimator-on");
00099         EnergySpectrum* energy_off= new EnergySpectrum(ri,"EnergyEstimator-off");
00100         energy_on->load("Totals/energy-total-on.hist");
00101         energy_off->load("Totals/energy-total-off.hist");
00102         
00103         int i;
00104         double lower,upper;
00105         cout << "Reading Data Histograms"<<endl
00106              << "  Bin    E_min     E_max         On       Off"<<endl;
00107         for (i=0;i<energy_on->numBins();i++) {
00108             energy_on->getRange( i, lower,upper );
00109             cout << setw(5) << i 
00110                  << setw(10) << pow(10,lower)
00111                  << setw(10) << pow(10,upper)
00112                  << setw(10) << energy_on->get(i) 
00113                  << setw(10) << energy_off->get(i) << endl;
00114         }
00115         cout << endl << endl;
00116         
00117         //
00118         // Define Fitter, That Loads Monte Carlo Data
00119         // From File "/data/Whipple/Simulations/mall.dat"
00120         //
00121         Fitter* fitter = new Fitter( ri );
00122         
00123         //
00124         // Start Actual Fitting Process
00125         // Save Chi-Square Table in File "Totals/chi.text"
00126         //
00127         fitter->minimize(energy_on,energy_off,
00128                          N0,Gamma,E0,Time,
00129                          dN0,n0Steps,dGamma,gSteps, onoffratio);
00130         
00131         //
00132         // Print Out Results and Save Reconstructed Energy Spectra in
00133         // "Totals/espectrum.text"
00134         //
00135         fitter->save();
00136         
00137         delete energy_on;
00138         delete energy_off;
00139         delete fitter;
00140     }
00141     catch (CriticalAnalysisException &e) {
00142         cout << "Critical: "<< e.what() << endl;
00143     }
00144     catch (AnalysisException &e) {
00145         cout << "Exception: "<< e.what() << endl;
00146     }
00147     
00148         
00149 }
